page.title: 07HOME LIFE IN CRANHAM
page.content: Most{JUNIOR SCHOOL}children walk to local schools,stay to lunch and return home to watch T.V. before evening meal.With a shortage of first-time- buyer homes,relatively few young families are moving into Upminster and with low birth rates junior school numbers are down for the time being. {SECONDARY SCHOOLS}are full due to the increased number of pupils coming from beyond Upminster.Older pupils gain better than national average exam results and spend considerable time watching T.V.,listening to music, using computers,participating in sports and going out with friends. Many have part-time jobs at the weekend. The"traditional"family home still prevails although one parent families, rising unemployment and dual wage earning are becoming more common.
